course.subject: MECH
course.name: Fundamentals of Aeronautical Engineering - Solid Mechanics
course.description: This course teaches fundamental knowledge of Solid Mechanics. Topics include basic concepts of forces, moments, equilibrium; principles of virtual work; analysis of structural members under axial load, torsion and bending; shear force and bending moment diagrams; buckling and structural stability. This course is intended for students without relevant background but who want to enroll to the Minor Program of Aeronautical Engineering. Instructor's approval is required for enrollment in the course.
course.exclusions: CIVL 2120, MECH 2040, MECH 3020
